metadata.title: CVE-2019-12855 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
In words.protocols.jabber.xmlstream in Twisted through 19.2.1, XMPP supportdid not verify certificates when used with TLS, allowing an attacker toMITM connections.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-12855` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-twisted - 13.2.0-1ubuntu1.2+esm1
python-twisted-bin - 13.2.0-1ubuntu1.2+esm1
python-twisted-core - 13.2.0-1ubuntu1.2+esm1
python-twisted-lore - 13.2.0-1ubuntu1.2+esm1
python-twisted-mail - 13.2.0-1ubuntu1.2+esm1
python-twisted-names - 13.2.0-1ubuntu1.2+esm1
python-twisted-news - 13.2.0-1ubuntu1.2+esm1
python-twisted-runner - 13.2.0-1ubuntu1.2+esm1
python-twisted-web - 13.2.0-1ubuntu1.2+esm1
python-twisted-words - 13.2.0-1ubuntu1.2+esm1
python-twisted-conch - 1:13.2.0-1ubuntu1.2+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: twisted package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '13.2.0-1ubuntu1.2+esm1').
twisted package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '13.2.0-1ubuntu1.2+esm1').
twisted-py3: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
